content: There is no information provided in the prev_chunk to assist with summarizing the curr_chunk. In Jackson County, Mississippi, an amendment is made to provide an alternative water supply and address combined sewer overflows. Funding for water projects in Manchester, New Hampshire and Atlanta, Georgia is also increased. Additionally, improvements are planned for Paterson, Passaic County, and Passaic Valley in New Jersey. In Paterson, Passaic County, and Passaic Valley, New Jersey, funding is increased by $5,000,000. In Elizabeth and North Hudson, New Jersey, funding adjustments are made, with $10,000,000 allocated for paragraph 33 and $20,000,000 for paragraph 34 for the North Hudson Sewerage Authority. SEC. 2. Upper Mississippi River Environmental Management Program amended. SEC. 3. Delaware River, Pennsylvania and Delaware amended. SEC. 4. Project reauthorizations. SEC. 4. Project reauthorizations: Projects authorized by the Secretary must be technically sound, environmentally acceptable, and economically justified. No construction can begin until these criteria are met. SEC. 5. SHORE PROTECTION. Amendment to the Water Resources Development Act of 1986 regarding project completion dates. SEC. 6. COMITE RIVER, LOUISIANA. SEC. 6. COMITE RIVER, LOUISIANA. Amendment to the Water Resources Development Act of 1999 regarding the Comite River Diversion Project and crediting reduction in non-Federal share towards project costs. SEC. 7. CHESAPEAKE CITY, MARYLAND. Amendment to the Water Resources Development Act of 1999 regarding the city of Chesapeake. SEC. 8. CONTINUATION OF SUBMISSION OF CERTAIN REPORTS BY THE SECRETARY OF THE ARMY. Amendments to various sections of the Water Resources Development Act of 1986 are made, including recommendations from the Inland Waterways Users Board, a list of authorized but unfunded studies, and reports on minority participation in the Mississippi River-Gulf Outlet Feature. Amendments are made to section 1001(b)(2) of the Water Resources Development Act of 1986 to include a list of authorized but unfunded projects, with a reference to Public Law 104-66. SEC. 9. Authorization for program previously and currently funded includes authorization of appropriations for the Department of Transportation in specific amounts for fiscal years 2000, 2001, and 2002. The program referenced is funded under Public Law 106-69. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
